alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 12:57PM EST until February 01 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers and locations in Indiana...Illinois... White River at Petersburg. Wabash River at Clinton, Terre Haute, Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Covington, Montezuma, and Lafayette. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is potential for flooding to develop later in the week at Vincennes and Mount Carmel. The crest is past Lafayette and should reach Covington by mid-morning Monday. The river is rising at all locations downstream. Flooding may last as long as Tuesday, February 6. Lowland flooding is either expected to develop, or may develop, on the lower White River by Monday night from about Edwardsport downstream to the Hazleton area. Flooding could last as long as Wednesday afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Sunday /10:30 AM CST Sunday/ the stage was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 17.9 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 200 PM EST /100 PM CST/.
